questions.title: Q003 Which of the following comparisons between diffusion and act
questions.prompt: Which of the following comparisons between diffusion and active transport is not correct?

choices.content: cell membrane is requiredcell membrane is not required
substances move from a region of higher concentration to a region of lower concentrationsubstances move from a region of lower concentration to a region of higher concentration
carrier proteins are not involvedcarrier proteins are involved

questions.title: Q004 [10133153] Directions: The following two questions refer to
questions.prompt:
[10133153]
Directions: The following two questions refer to the investigation below. Beetroot cells contain a red pigment in the vacuoles. A student cut some cubes (1 cm x 1 cm x 1 cm) from a beetroot and washed them in running water for 20 minutes. The cubes were then put into test tubes containing distilled water and alcohol of different concentrations (W, X, Y and Z) for 30 minutes. The table below shows the colour intensity of the solutions after 30 minutes.

questions.title: Q005 Which alcohol is highest in concentration?
Q007 [10133167] Which of the following is/are correct explanation
questions.prompt:
[10133167]
Which of the following is/are correct explanation(s) of the experimental results?
(1) The phospholipids in the cell membrane dissolve in alcohol.
(2) The pigment molecules are non-polar and thus can move across the phospholipid bilayer.
(3) Carrier proteins are present on the cell membrane of the beetroot cells to transport the pigment molecules.

embedded half-way in the phospholipid bilayerspans the entire phospholipid bilayer
spans the entire phospholipid bilayerattached to the surface of the phospholipid bilayer
spans the entire phospholipid bilayerspans the entire phospholipid bilayer
